column10: p.161,164 "Since we do not operate any industrial manufacturing facilities (with one exception in Argentina), the amount of hazardous waste created in PUMA’s own operations is very low at 36 tons. The 36 tons originate from our factory in Argentina (26 tons) and the exchange of old lighting systems to LED at the PUMA headquarters (9 tons). All hazardous waste is handled strictly in line with hazardous waste regulations." "Waste (t)" "Total waste from own operations - 5,595" "Total waste from PUMA production (core Tier 1 and 2) - 38,594" "Calculation: 5595+38594 = 44189 "Figures include PUMA owned or operated offices, warehouses and stores. Includes our own production sites in Argentina. All other production is outsourced to independent supplier factories, some warehouse operations are outsourced to independent logistics providers. Franchised stores are excluded." Pooja Yadav[https://wikirate.org/Pooja_Yadav].....2024-03-19 08:27:26 UTC p.164 "Total waste from own operations - 5,595 Recycled waste - 3,598" ...

We implemented ongoing activities to reduce waste, such as switching to returnable shipping cartons at the Toride Plant and Canon Vietnam and reducing waste from the metal stamping process at Canon Hi-Tech (Thailand). However, due to factors such as an increase in packaging materials due to greater distribution of components at production sites, CO2 emissions were up 6% from 2021. column2: Global Reporting Initiative+Total Waste Generated, GRI 306-2 (formerly G4-EN23-a)
column10: In the report, the company does not provide the total number of waste generated but only the total for each of the following categories: Incinerated (5.5 kt); To sanitary landfill (58.8 kt); Special waste (1.5 kt); Recycled (160.5 kt); Disposed of for land applications (40.9kt); Total solid waste (267.2 kt); Brewer’s grain and brewer’s yeast utilised (1292.3 kt). Therefore, the total reported here refers only to the abovementioned categories and was obtained by summing each category's values (5.5 kt + 58.8 kt + 1.5 kt + 160.5 kt + 40.9 kt + 267.2 kt + 1292.3 kt = 1827.7 kt). Benedetta Paparelli[https://wikirate.org/Benedetta_Paparelli].....2023-10-05 19:21:43 UTC

"We have diverted 80% of our waste from landfill through recycling, composting, and donations".This information can be found on p.77 of the report. Global Reporting Initiative+Total Waste Generated, GRI 306-2 (formerly G4-EN23-a)
column10: The following information can be found on page 168 of the annual report 2021 for Corbion. The figure given for the total waste generated is 26.0 kilo-tonnes, converted into tonnes this gives a figure of 26,000 tonnes of generated total waste for Corbion. In addition, the table also shows specific figures for hazardous and non-hazardous waste which make up the total figure. For hazardous waste the figure was 1.17 kT (1,170 Tonnes) and for non-hazardous the figure was as follows: 24.83 kT (24830 Tonnes). The figures given for 2020, the non hazardous figure decreased while for hazardous waste, the figure slightly increased when comparing this one to the one's published in 2021. However, despite these, the total waste figure has decreased from 27900 in 2020 to 26000 tonnes in 2021. Angelika Magiera[https://wikirate.org/Angelika_Magiera].....2022-10-09 18:13:54 UTC

column10: Pg. 108: Under the table called "GRI 303: Water and Effluents and GRI 306: Waste" the total amount of "Total Non-hazardous Waste Generated (short tons)" can be found. Note: "Total Non-hazardous Waste Generated (short tons)" is the total of "Total Non-hazardous Waste Landfilled (short tons)" which is 2,843 plus the Total Non-hazardous Waste Recycled (short tons) which is 201, thereby equalling 3,044. The 3,044 figure is in short tons which has then been convereted to metric tonnes. Jacob Hovsgaard Olyaei[https://wikirate.org/Jacob_Hovsgaard_Olyaei].....2022-10-13 09:52:47 UTC Pg. 108: The accuracy of C&W reporting can be questioned as they state the following: "All waste generation and diversion via recycling from landfill is estimated using industry average intensities for large commercial office buildings." column10: Radisson Hospitality AB did not report the amount of waste generated by the organisation. However, they report their practices in trying to reduce waste. For example, Radisson Blu Resort Maldives has its own on-site water bottling plant on the island. This practice reduces the use of thousands of plastic water bottles a year, avoiding possible threats to the country’s rich marine life and magnificent ocean. On average, the resort is preventing 4.5 tons of possible plastic waste each year. Additionally, 10 Radisson Hotels in Europe partner with Too Good To Go which have saved 15,367 meals which correspond to a CO2 reduction of 37.6 tons. Page 55. Eleni[https://wikirate.org/Eleni].....2022-02-24 15:13:52 UTC

column10: “In 2019, we used a total of 23 tonnes of paper for our office use (almost the same as 2018) In 2019, we used a total of 1,105 printer cartridges. In 2019, we saw a significant increase in batteries (from 152 tonnes to 495 tonnes) and other hazardous waste (from 190 tonnes to 637 tonnes), which was either recycled or safely disposed Graph for Recycling 2019: 5.99 tonnes of paper recycled, 15.48 tonnes of plastic recycled, 15.19 tonnes of cardboard recycled” (Page 84 Company Annual Report 2019). 23 + 495 + 637 + 15.48 + 15.19 = 1,185.67 Tonnes This is the minimum volume of wastage, based on the volume of reported waste and proportion of recycled waste, so a proportion of unrecycled plastic and cardboard waste is missing from the calculation. column10: Although the exact figure of total waste generated is unknown, Tsogo Sun do not pose a huge risk of unnecessary waste. In their annual report it says that the gaming and hotel businesses pose limited risks to the environment due to the service nature of the industry. Tsogo Sun operates predominantly in urban areas, which further reduces the biodiversity impact. The main environmental impacts of the group are the consumption of energy and water, the production of waste and travel of guests to their hotels. This shows that Tsogo Sun are aware of their energy and water waste but continue to operate in mostly urban areas and thus reduces the biodiversity impact on the environment. Louise Ellen Walker[https://wikirate.org/Louise_Ellen_Walker].....2021-02-03 21:15:57 UTC

Boiler ash = 111,159 (51%) (Calculation of total waste: 111,159*100/51 = 217,958.8235) pg. 73 "In 2018, solid waste disposed of in the landfill predominantly consisted of boiler ash (51%), followed by sludge (34%) and dregs and grits (15%). A significant decrease of boiler ash from 166,861 tonnes in 2017 to 111,159 tonnes in 2018 was due to a decrease in the use of fossil fuel in production as a result of increased biofuels generation." pg. 58 "A total of 4,479,379 tonnes (= 1.73 t/adt) of black liquor was recycled for biofuel production in 2018. This increase from 2017 is due to the increased production of dissolving pulp during the year, which generates more black liquor. There was also an increase in the recovery of bark and palm husk from 1,008,828 tonnes in 2017 to 1,106,634 tonnes in 2018." Singh Anjali[https://...

column10: Pg. 37 : Total Waste Generated (MT) - FY 2018-19 : 4233 The sustainability performance disclosures in this report pertain to our corporate offices in Mumbai and Bengaluru, factories, warehouses and retail stores. In addition to the seven factories reported in FY 2018 and FY 2017, this year we have included the eighth factory, Little England Apparels. We have followed the Global Reporting Initiative GRI Standards: Core, on defining the report boundary. We have continued using the gate-to-gate approach for disclosures, and unless otherwise stated, this report does not include any data and/or information which pertains to any entity outside our organisation (such as suppliers) Isha Rai[https://wikirate.org/Isha_Rai].....2021-03-26 11:12:41 UTC

column10: In order to find total waste, the following values had to be added: Drinking water from utilities (144,383 m3 or 144,383,000 kg) + Well water (7,073 m3 or 7,073,000 kg) + Hazardous waste (104,755 kg) + Non-hazardous waste (2,228,031 kg) = 153,788,786 kg. All the values expressed in cubic meters had to be converted to kg using Convertunits.com[http://Convertunits.com]. The total value was converted to tonnes using Convertunits.com[http://Convertunits.com]: 153,788.786 metric tonnes All of this information was found on the table in section 9.11 Table of other non-financial indicators, in the subsection titled "Environment" in pages 71-72 of the Corporate Social Responsibility Report 2018 of INDRA. Virginia Rodríguez Castelló[https://wikirate.org/Virginia_Rodríguez_Castelló].....2022-02-28 15:11:22 UTC The total waste generated by INDRA in 2018 is shown in page 63 of the "Informa de sostenibilidad 2019" of this firm. column10: p. 56 "Yara’s production operations generated about 65,700 tonnes of non-hazardous waste (58,700 in 2016) and 15,600 tonnes of hazardous waste in 2017 (6,600 tonnes in 2016). 72% of all non-hazardous waste was recycled in 2017, the same share as in 2016. The increase in hazardous waste and the reduction of recycled hazardous waste (only 12% in 2017 compared to 40% in 2016) were due to one investment project, where the phase-out of a hazardous chemical required an extensive clean-up of process equipment, generating more than 9,000 tonnes of hazardous waste. In addition, 1,700 tonnes of the increase in non-hazardous waste was due to the demolition of an old building." Nikki Nauman[https://wikirate.org/Nikki_Nauman].....2019-02-21 15:29:53 UTC

column10: Enka de Colombia S.A no reporta la cantidad de residuos que genera, pues su objetivo es mantener el valor de sus materias primas y recursos, creando un sistema que permite alargar su vida útil enfocándose en el cierre de los ciclos a través de la reutilización y el reciclaje. Por tanto, la cantidad de "residuos producidos" sería igual a las toneladas de residuos reciclados (1534 para este año). Valeria Vélez Ramírez[https://wikirate.org/Valeria_Vélez_Ramírez].....2019-10-25 15:27:08 UTC Otra fuente de información empleada fue http://www.enka.com.co/enka/index.php/es/content/download/331/5094/file/INFORMESOSTENIBILIDAD2018.pdf Valeria Vélez Ramírez[https://wikirate.org/Valeria_Vélez_Ramírez].....2019-10-25 17:53:27 UTC

(Ghirardelli's production facility in the USA (a brand of Lindt & Sprüngli AG), introduced recycling and waste avoidance measures with a view to reducing the amount of its own waste sent to landfill. column10: "The growing demand for ICT products and mobile devices, and their increasingly short lifespans, has resulted in e-waste becoming a significant concern and risk for the ICT industry. In this regard, all business units are mandated to secure sustainable waste management. All electronic waste is to be reused, recycled or safely disposed of, and all business units are to ensure that these processes are conducted according to internationally recognised standards and regulations." - pg. 21 "Mobile handset recycling initiatives have been ongoing for several years in nine of our business units: Telenor Hungary, Telenor Serbia, Telenor Montenegro, Digi in Malaysia, dtac in Thailand, Telenor Sweden, Telenor Denmark, Telenor Norway and Telenor Bulgaria, and in 2017 Grameenphone also started their mobile recycling initiative. Across Telenor, a total of more than 168,000 mobile handsets and mobile batteries were collected and recycled in 2017. During 2016/2017, updated guidelines/manuals for proper handling of e-waste...

column10: The calculation performed was used using the Waste production per employee in 2016 chart found on page 170. The average waste production per employee was calculated among the countries measured to be 235.5 kg. This was multiplied by the total full-time employees (112,000) resulting in 26,376,000 kg. This number was then converted into metric tonnes resulting in 26,376 metric tonnes total. Alexandra Satok[https://wikirate.org/Alexandra_Satok].....2017-05-31 15:49:48 UTC

column10: Enka de Colombia S.A no reporta la cantidad de residuos que genera, pues los puntos ecológicos presentes en diferentes áreas de la empresa le han permitido recuperar los residuos para convertirlos en material reciclable. Por tanto, la cantidad de "residuos producidos" sería igual a las toneladas de residuos reciclados (1356 para este año). column10: Our collieries generate consumable waste, processing waste and development waste. Recycling of consumable waste has been limited to scrap metal and used oils, but we are considering introducing recycling programmes to further reduce consumable waste and lower operating costs. Processing waste is produced during the beneficiation of coal. Processing plant fine coal discard, or slurry, has for many years been stored in purpose-built Tailings Storage Facilities (TSFs) or co-disposal facilities. column10: La cantidad de resiudos generados es 42618 en toneladas metricas Mariana Ochoa[https://wikirate.org/Mariana_Ochoa].....2018-11-02 18:27:48 UTC En la página 40 se mencionan diferentes residuos que la Constructora ha reciclado y dispuesto para la venta, generando un ingreso adicional. Los valores de la tabla están dados en Kilogramos, salvo el de aceite quemado, que está representado en Metros cúbicos. Para la conversión de estos valores a toneladas, primero pasé los metros cúbicos a litros, para después pasarlos a kilogramos. Una vez con todos los valores en Kilogramos, hice la sumatoria y los convertí toneladas métricas. Llegando a un valor de 3.788,955 toneladas métricas generadas por Constructora Bolívar. Miguel Ángel Gonzalez Usuga[https://wikirate.org/Miguel_Ángel_Gonzalez_Usuga].....2018-11-04 00:09:16 UTC

Haciendo la respectiva suma de todos los residuos que tuvieron da un resultado de 2.233.610Kg de basura, que convirtiendolo en toneladas nos da un resultado de 2.233,61 toneladas metricas de basura Alejandro Arango Puerta[https://wikirate.org/Alejandro_Arango_Puerta].....2018-11-06 04:25:05 UTC

column2: Global Reporting Initiative+Total Waste Generated, GRI 306-2 (formerly G4-EN23-a)
column10: Residuos generados: [G4-EN23] Para el año 2015 se generaron en total 389.012 Kg de residuos, de los cuales 144.670 Kg fueron catalogados como ordinarios, 21% menos en comparación al año anterior debido a que se optimizó el aprovechamiento de los residuos al interior de la Empresa.222.253 Kg de residuos fueron clasificados como reciclables aprovechables (chatarra, limalla, vidrio, papel y cartón, entre otros) y 22.089 Kg fueron catalogados como peligrosos. Aprovechamiento: [G4-EN2] Para el año 2015, se realizó el aprovechamiento de 3.582 kg de residuos peligrosos, generando un ahorro para la Empresa de aproximadamente 4.3 millones de pesos por no disponer esta cantidad de residuos. valentina Rodriguez[https://wikirate.org/valentina_Rodriguez].....2018-05-18 17:33:25 UTC

column10: Calculated using values provided for tyres disposed, waste paper generated, oil recycled and oil spilled. column10: p. 250 "The amount of waste produced throughout the Group increased slightly compared to 2011. We were able to reduce the amount of technical waste produced throughout the Group by around 7 percent year-on-year. However, the total amount of hazardous, non-technical waste increased due to significantly higher waste production at T-Systems Austria and Magyar Telekom. In addition, the higher amount of "other waste" can be attributed to increased production of wooden packaging waste at our Hungarian subsidiary as well as the fact that our Austrian subsidiary shut down its archives, which involved increased waste disposal." 68220 tonnes = 69314,720118336 metric tonnes https://www.convertunits.com/from/ton/to/metric+ton Toni Daniel Coimbra Figueiredo[https://wikirate.org/Toni_Daniel_Coimbra_Figueiredo].....2022-04-21 11:08:31 UTC 68220 tonnes = 61888,142962800004 metric tonnes https://www.convertunits.com/from/ton/to/metric+ton Toni Daniel Coimbra Figueiredo[https://wikirate.org/Toni_Daniel_Coimbra_Figueiredo].....

column2: Global Reporting Initiative+Total Waste Generated, GRI 306-2 (formerly G4-EN23-a)
column10: p. 293 "The amount of total waste sunk by around 6% throughout the Group in 2010. This reduction was basically the result of less waste being produced by the cable project in Germany as well as the reductions in paper and residual waste resulting from employee reduction efforts. Reduction came to at the international subsidiaries, particulalry as a result of the deconsolidation of T-Mobile UK. The share of the entire amount of waste produced by the Group that was produced outside of Germany increased slightly from 34.6% to 35.2%." 47080 tonnes = 47835,488466304 metric tonnes https://www.convertunits.com/from/ton/to/metric+ton Toni Daniel Coimbra Figueiredo[https://wikirate.org/Toni_Daniel_Coimbra_Figueiredo].....2022-04-21 11:48:26 UTC 47080 tonnes = 42710,2575592 metric tonnes https://www.convertunits.com/from/ton/to/metric+ton Toni Daniel Coimbra Figueiredo[https://wikirate.org/Toni_Daniel_Coimbra_Figueiredo].....2022-04-22 04:42:10 UTC
